standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001:2022
standard.organization: International Organization for Standardization (ISO) / International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC)
standard.description: Information security, cybersecurity and privacy protection — Information security management systems — Requirements

controls.name: Policies for information security
controls.description: Define, approve, publish, communicate and review information security policies

article.full_text: A set of policies for information security shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
article.guidance: Information security policy provides management direction and support for information security in accordance with business requirements and relevant laws and regulations. Management should establish information security policies and demonstrate support and commitment to information security through clear direction, demonstrated commitment, explicit assignment and acknowledgment of information security responsibilities.

controls.name: Information security roles and responsibilities
controls.description: Define and allocate information security responsibilities

article.full_text: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organization needs. Responsibilities for the protection of individual assets and for carrying out specific information security processes shall be defined. Responsibilities for information security risk management activities and in particular for acceptance of residual risks shall be defined. These responsibilities shall be supplemented, where necessary, with detailed guidance for specific sites and information processing facilities. Local responsibilities for the protection of assets and for carrying out specific security processes shall be defined.
article.guidance: The allocation of responsibilities for information security should be done at an organizational level. The responsibilities of individual assets and of information security processes should be defined. Particular attention should be given to the need for information security risk management activities and acceptance of residual risks.

controls.name: Segregation of duties
controls.description: Segregate conflicting duties and areas of responsibility

article.full_text: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.
article.guidance: Segregation of duties is a method for reducing the risk of accidental or deliberate misuse of an organization's assets. The aim is to ensure that no single person can access, modify or use assets without authorization or detection. The initiation of an event should be separated from its authorization. The possibility of collusion should be considered in designing the controls.

controls.name: Management responsibilities
controls.description: Require management to apply information security according to established policies

article.full_text: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established policies, topic-specific policies, rules and procedures of the organization.
article.guidance: Management should ensure that security roles and responsibilities are assigned, communicated and accepted. Management should also ensure that adequate resources are allocated to information security activities. Management should review and approve information security policies, assign security roles and authorize exceptions to information security policies.

controls.name: Contact with authorities
controls.description: Maintain contact with relevant authorities

article.full_text: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.
article.guidance: The organization should maintain contact with authorities such as: law enforcement authorities; fire authorities; utility providers; internet service providers; telecommunications operators; supervisory authorities; emergency services; authorities responsible for maintaining or accessing public infrastructure; health authorities.

controls.name: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: Maintain contact with special interest groups and security forums

article.full_text: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.
article.guidance: Membership of special interest groups or forums can help the organization: stay up-to-date on current security threats; keep up-to-date with best practice and maintain awareness of developments in information security management; receive early warning alerts about new threats; gain access to specialist information security advice; share information and coordinate security issues with other organizations.

controls.name: Threat intelligence
controls.description: Collect and analyze threat intelligence information

article.full_text: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analyzed to produce threat intelligence.
article.guidance: Organizations should collect information about threats from sources such as: security forums; information sharing networks; threat intelligence providers; specialist security organizations; government agencies; websites and mailing lists; social media; publicly available vulnerability databases; security research publications.

controls.name: Information security in project management
controls.description: Integrate information security in project management

article.full_text: Information security shall be integrated in project management.
article.guidance: Project management methodology should ensure that information security is addressed within projects. Information security should be included in all phases: project initiation; project planning; project execution; project monitoring and control; project closure. Security requirements should be identified and agreed upon during the project initiation phase.

controls.name: Inventory of information and other associated assets
controls.description: Develop and maintain an inventory of information and assets

article.section_name: Inventory of information and other associated assets
article.full_text: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.
article.guidance: The organization should identify and record all information assets. The inventory should include: information; hardware; software; services; people; locations; intangible assets. Each asset should have an identified owner who has responsibility for the asset. Assets should be classified according to their importance.

controls.name: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
controls.description: Define and implement acceptable use rules

article.section_name: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
article.full_text: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.
article.guidance: Acceptable use policy should address: authorized use of information assets; restrictions on use; responsibility for maintaining confidentiality; copyright and intellectual property; use of organizational devices for personal purposes; monitoring and privacy considerations.

controls.name: Return of assets
controls.description: Ensure employees return all organizational assets upon termination

article.full_text: Personnel and external parties shall return all of the organizational assets in their possession upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement.
article.guidance: The return of assets process should: be documented in employment terms and conditions; include all types of assets (physical and electronic); include access credentials; be verified as part of termination procedures; include data deletion from personal devices.

controls.name: Classification of information
controls.description: Classify information according to legal requirements and business value

article.full_text: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.
article.guidance: A classification scheme should be developed considering: legal and contractual requirements; business value; criticality; sensitivity. Common classification levels include: Public; Internal; Confidential; Restricted. Each classification level should have defined handling requirements.

controls.name: Labelling of information
controls.description: Develop and implement labelling procedures

article.full_text: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.
article.guidance: Labelling procedures should address: output from systems; physical media; email messages; file shares; databases. Labels should be: clearly visible; standardized; easy to understand; automated where possible.

controls.name: Information transfer
controls.description: Maintain information security during information transfer

article.full_text: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.
article.guidance: Information transfer procedures should address: electronic messaging; file transfers; physical transport; verbal communication. Security measures should include: encryption; access controls; audit trails; secure transmission protocols; integrity checking.

controls.name: Access control
controls.description: Establish and implement access control rules

article.full_text: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
article.guidance: Access control policy should address: user access management; user responsibilities; system and application access control; secure log-on procedures; password management; use of privileged access rights; access rights review.

controls.name: Identity management
controls.description: Manage full lifecycle of identities

article.full_text: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.
article.guidance: Identity management should cover: identity registration; identity verification; identity provisioning; identity maintenance; identity de-provisioning; identity review. Unique user IDs should be used for accountability.

controls.name: Authentication information
controls.description: Securely allocate and manage authentication information

article.full_text: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.
article.guidance: Authentication management should include: secure distribution; temporary authentication for new users; password complexity requirements; regular password changes; protection during storage and transmission; multi-factor authentication where appropriate.

controls.name: Access rights
controls.description: Provision, review, modify and remove access rights

article.full_text: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
article.guidance: Access rights management should include: formal access request; access approval by asset owner; implementation of access; regular access review; removal of access when no longer required; privilege escalation procedures.

controls.name: Information security in supplier relationships
controls.description: Define and agree information security requirements with suppliers

article.full_text: Processes and procedures shall be defined and agreed with each supplier to maintain an appropriate level of information security and service delivery in line with supplier agreements.
article.guidance: Supplier security should address: security requirements in supplier selection; security clauses in agreements; supply chain security; service delivery management; monitoring and review; incident management.

controls.name: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
controls.description: Include relevant security requirements in supplier agreements

article.section_name: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
article.full_text: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
article.guidance: Supplier agreements should include: description of information to be provided; classification of information; legal and regulatory requirements; right to audit; incident management procedures; termination clauses; subcontracting arrangements.

controls.name: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
controls.description: Define and implement security processes for ICT supply chain

article.section_name: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
article.full_text: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.
article.guidance: ICT supply chain security should address: supplier security assessment; product security verification; secure acquisition; software provenance; supply chain monitoring; resilience planning.

controls.name: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
controls.description: Monitor, review and manage changes in supplier services

article.section_name: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
article.full_text: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.
article.guidance: Supplier monitoring should include: performance reviews; security audits; compliance verification; change management; incident review; continuous improvement.

controls.name: Information security for use of cloud services
controls.description: Secure acquisition, use and management of cloud services

article.section_name: Information security for use of cloud services
article.full_text: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.
article.guidance: Cloud security should address: cloud service provider assessment; data location and sovereignty; data protection and encryption; access control; service level agreements; exit strategy; vendor lock-in avoidance.

controls.name: Information security incident management planning and preparation
controls.description: Plan and prepare for managing information security incidents

article.section_name: Information security incident management planning and preparation
article.full_text: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
article.guidance: Incident management planning should include: incident response procedures; escalation procedures; roles and responsibilities; communication plans; evidence collection; forensics capabilities; training and awareness.

controls.name: Assessment and decision on information security events
controls.description: Assess and classify information security events

article.section_name: Assessment and decision on information security events
article.full_text: The organization shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.
article.guidance: Event assessment should include: event detection; event logging; event analysis; severity classification; incident declaration; escalation criteria.

controls.name: Response to information security incidents
controls.description: Respond to information security incidents according to documented procedures

article.full_text: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.
article.guidance: Incident response should include: containment; eradication; recovery; evidence preservation; communication; documentation; lessons learned.

controls.name: Learning from information security incidents
controls.description: Use knowledge from security incidents to strengthen security

article.full_text: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.
article.guidance: Learning processes should include: post-incident review; root cause analysis; control effectiveness evaluation; improvement recommendations; knowledge sharing; metrics and trends.

controls.name: Collection of evidence
controls.description: Establish procedures for evidence collection and preservation

article.full_text: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence.
article.guidance: Evidence handling should address: chain of custody; forensic procedures; legal admissibility; evidence storage; evidence disposal; expert involvement.

controls.name: Information security during disruption
controls.description: Maintain information security during disruption

article.full_text: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
article.guidance: Disruption planning should include: business continuity integration; alternative procedures; reduced security controls documentation; recovery priorities; testing and exercises.

controls.name: ICT readiness for business continuity
controls.description: Ensure ICT readiness to support business continuity

article.full_text: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.
article.guidance: ICT continuity should address: backup procedures; redundancy; alternative sites; recovery time objectives; recovery point objectives; testing and maintenance.

controls.name: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
controls.description: Identify and meet legal and contractual security requirements

article.section_name: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
article.full_text: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.
article.guidance: Compliance requirements should be: identified for each information system; documented; reviewed regularly; assigned ownership; integrated into processes.

controls.name: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: Implement procedures to protect intellectual property rights

article.full_text: The organization shall implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.
article.guidance: IPR protection should include: software licensing compliance; copyright protection; trademark protection; patent protection; trade secret protection; usage policies.

controls.name: Protection of records
controls.description: Protect records from loss, destruction and falsification

article.full_text: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.
article.guidance: Record protection should address: retention requirements; storage security; access controls; backup procedures; destruction procedures; audit trails.

controls.name: Privacy and protection of PII
controls.description: Ensure privacy and protection of personally identifiable information

article.full_text: The organization shall identify and meet requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.
article.guidance: Privacy protection should include: data minimization; purpose limitation; consent management; data subject rights; privacy by design; data protection impact assessments; international data transfers.

controls.name: Independent review of information security
controls.description: Conduct independent reviews of information security

article.full_text: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.
article.guidance: Independent reviews should: be performed by competent assessors; cover all aspects of ISMS; identify non-conformities; provide improvement recommendations; be documented; result in action plans.

controls.name: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
controls.description: Verify compliance with security policies and standards

article.section_name: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
article.full_text: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.
article.guidance: Compliance verification should include: regular audits; automated compliance checking; management reviews; self-assessments; remediation tracking.

controls.name: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Document and maintain operating procedures for information processing facilities

article.full_text: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.
article.guidance: Operating procedures should cover: system startup and shutdown; backup procedures; scheduling requirements; error handling; system monitoring; media handling; incident management.

controls.name: Screening
controls.description: Conduct background verification checks on all candidates for employment

article.full_text: Background verification checks on all candidates for employment shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.
article.guidance: Background screening should include: identity verification; employment history; education verification; criminal records check; credit check (where appropriate); reference checks. The level of screening should be commensurate with the role sensitivity.

controls.name: Terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: Include security responsibilities in employment contracts

article.full_text: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.
article.guidance: Employment contracts should address: confidentiality agreements; acceptable use policies; responsibilities for asset protection; intellectual property rights; disciplinary process; termination procedures; post-employment obligations.

controls.name: Information security awareness, education and training
controls.description: Provide security awareness, education and training to all employees

article.section_name: Information security awareness, education and training
article.full_text: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
article.guidance: Security training should include: induction training; role-specific training; regular refresher training; specialized technical training; awareness campaigns; phishing simulations; metrics and effectiveness measurement.

controls.name: Disciplinary process
controls.description: Establish formal disciplinary process for security violations

article.full_text: A formal disciplinary process shall be in place to take action against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.
article.guidance: Disciplinary process should: be fair and consistent; be clearly documented; be communicated to all personnel; consider severity of violation; include progressive discipline; comply with employment laws; be enforced consistently.

controls.name: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
controls.description: Define security responsibilities after employment changes

article.section_name: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
article.full_text: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.
article.guidance: Post-employment responsibilities should include: ongoing confidentiality obligations; return of assets; knowledge transfer; exit interviews; access revocation; continuing restrictions.

controls.name: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Require confidentiality agreements from employees and contractors

article.full_text: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and relevant interested parties.
article.guidance: NDAs should: cover all forms of information; specify duration of obligation; define permitted disclosures; include legal remedies; be reviewed regularly; be updated when requirements change.

controls.name: Remote working
controls.description: Implement security measures for remote working

article.full_text: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization's premises.
article.guidance: Remote working security should include: secure access methods; endpoint security; physical security at remote location; acceptable use policy; equipment provisions; data protection; network security.

controls.name: Information security event reporting
controls.description: Provide mechanism for reporting security events

article.full_text: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.
article.guidance: Event reporting should include: multiple reporting channels; clear procedures; confidential reporting options; no-blame culture; feedback mechanism; tracking system; escalation procedures.

controls.name: Physical security perimeters
controls.description: Define and protect physical security perimeters

article.full_text: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.
article.guidance: Physical perimeters should: be clearly defined; provide appropriate protection; consider natural and man-made threats; include multiple layers; be monitored; have controlled entry points.

controls.name: Physical entry
controls.description: Control physical entry to secure areas

article.full_text: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.
article.guidance: Entry controls should include: access cards; biometrics; security guards; visitor logs; escort requirements; access reviews; tailgating prevention.

controls.name: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
controls.description: Design and implement physical security for offices and facilities

article.full_text: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.
article.guidance: Facility security should address: location selection; construction standards; environmental controls; fire suppression; power supply; cabling security; maintenance access.

controls.name: Physical security monitoring
controls.description: Monitor premises continuously for unauthorized physical access

article.full_text: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.
article.guidance: Physical monitoring should include: CCTV systems; intrusion detection; security patrols; alarm systems; access logs; incident response; recording retention.

controls.name: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
controls.description: Design and implement protection against physical and environmental threats

article.section_name: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
article.full_text: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure shall be designed and implemented.
article.guidance: Environmental protection should address: fire detection and suppression; flood protection; earthquake protection; temperature and humidity control; power backup; lightning protection.

controls.name: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Design and implement security measures for working in secure areas

article.full_text: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.
article.guidance: Secure area procedures should include: clear desk policy; visitor supervision; photography restrictions; sensitive information handling; screen privacy; equipment removal procedures.

controls.name: Clear desk and clear screen
controls.description: Enforce clear desk and clear screen policies

article.full_text: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.
article.guidance: Clear desk/screen policy should address: locking screens when unattended; securing papers in storage; disposing of waste securely; locking removable media; visitor considerations; enforcement and monitoring.

controls.name: Equipment siting and protection
controls.description: Locate and protect equipment appropriately

article.full_text: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.
article.guidance: Equipment protection should consider: environmental conditions; physical access; power supply; electromagnetic interference; visibility from outside; cable protection.

controls.name: Security of assets off-premises
controls.description: Protect assets outside organizational premises

article.full_text: Off-site assets shall be protected.
article.guidance: Off-site asset protection should include: authorization requirements; transportation security; remote working controls; encryption; tracking; insurance; physical security at off-site locations.

controls.name: Storage media
controls.description: Manage storage media according to classification

article.full_text: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme and handling requirements.
article.guidance: Media management should cover: media registration; secure storage; authorized access; transportation procedures; sanitization before reuse; secure disposal; audit trails.

controls.name: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Protect information processing facilities from utility failures

article.full_text: Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
article.guidance: Utility protection should include: UPS systems; backup generators; redundant power feeds; telecommunications redundancy; water supply; HVAC backup; fuel supplies; regular testing.

controls.name: Cabling security
controls.description: Protect cables from interception, interference or damage

article.full_text: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage.
article.guidance: Cable security should include: underground or protected routing; cable shielding; separation of power and data cables; access restrictions; cable labeling; documentation; regular inspection.

controls.name: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Maintain equipment to ensure availability and integrity

article.full_text: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information.
article.guidance: Equipment maintenance should include: regular servicing; maintenance records; authorized personnel only; data sanitization before service; spare parts availability; vendor support agreements.

controls.name: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
controls.description: Securely dispose of or re-use equipment containing storage media

article.section_name: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
article.full_text: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
article.guidance: Equipment disposal should include: data sanitization procedures; physical destruction when necessary; verification of data removal; disposal tracking; certificate of destruction; environmental considerations.

controls.name: User endpoint devices
controls.description: Protect information on user endpoint devices

article.full_text: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.
article.guidance: Endpoint protection should include: anti-malware; encryption; screen locks; approved software only; patch management; mobile device management; remote wipe capability; BYOD policies.

controls.name: Privileged access rights
controls.description: Restrict and control allocation of privileged access rights

article.full_text: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
article.guidance: Privileged access should be: granted based on need; regularly reviewed; monitored and logged; subject to approval; time-limited where appropriate; used through dedicated accounts; protected by strong authentication.

controls.name: Information access restriction
controls.description: Restrict access to information and application system functions

article.full_text: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
article.guidance: Access restrictions should implement: need-to-know principle; role-based access; attribute-based access; least privilege; separation of duties; default deny; access logging.

controls.name: Access to source code
controls.description: Control read and write access to source code

article.full_text: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.
article.guidance: Source code protection should include: version control; access restrictions; code review requirements; separation of environments; change management; backup procedures; intellectual property protection.

controls.name: Secure authentication
controls.description: Implement secure authentication technologies and procedures

article.full_text: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
article.guidance: Authentication should include: multi-factor authentication; password complexity; biometrics where appropriate; single sign-on; session management; authentication logs; account lockout.

controls.name: Capacity management
controls.description: Monitor and adjust capacity to meet performance requirements

article.full_text: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.
article.guidance: Capacity management should include: resource monitoring; trend analysis; capacity planning; performance tuning; scalability planning; bottleneck identification; regular reviews.

controls.name: Protection against malware
controls.description: Implement protection against malware

article.full_text: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
article.guidance: Malware protection should include: anti-malware software; regular updates; scanning procedures; quarantine capabilities; incident response; user training; application whitelisting; email filtering.

controls.name: Management of technical vulnerabilities
controls.description: Identify and manage technical vulnerabilities

article.full_text: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities evaluated and appropriate measures taken.
article.guidance: Vulnerability management should include: vulnerability scanning; patch management; vulnerability assessment; risk evaluation; remediation prioritization; tracking and metrics; vendor notifications.

controls.name: Configuration management
controls.description: Establish and maintain configurations including security configurations

article.full_text: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
article.guidance: Configuration management should include: baseline configurations; change control; configuration documentation; automated deployment; compliance monitoring; configuration audits; version control.

controls.name: Information deletion
controls.description: Delete information when no longer required

article.full_text: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media shall be deleted when no longer required.
article.guidance: Information deletion should address: retention requirements; deletion procedures; secure deletion methods; verification of deletion; automated deletion; backup considerations; legal holds.

controls.name: Data masking
controls.description: Use data masking according to access control policy

article.full_text: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
article.guidance: Data masking should include: test data masking; production data protection; masking methods (redaction, substitution, shuffling); masking consistency; reversibility considerations; audit logging.

controls.name: Data leakage prevention
controls.description: Apply data leakage prevention measures

article.full_text: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.
article.guidance: DLP should include: content inspection; contextual analysis; policy enforcement; encryption enforcement; removable media control; email monitoring; cloud access security; incident alerting.

controls.name: Information backup
controls.description: Maintain backup copies of information and test restoration

article.full_text: Backup copies of information, software and systems shall be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.
article.guidance: Backup procedures should include: backup scheduling; off-site storage; encryption of backups; retention management; restoration testing; backup monitoring; documentation; version control.

controls.name: Redundancy of information processing facilities
controls.description: Implement redundancy for availability requirements

article.full_text: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.
article.guidance: Redundancy should include: redundant systems; load balancing; failover capabilities; geographic distribution; regular testing; maintenance procedures; capacity planning.

controls.name: Logging
controls.description: Produce, store and protect logs recording activities and events

article.full_text: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analyzed.
article.guidance: Logging should include: event logging; log protection; time synchronization; log retention; log analysis; security information and event management (SIEM); alerting; audit trails.

controls.name: Monitoring activities
controls.description: Monitor networks, systems and applications for anomalies

article.full_text: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate action taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
article.guidance: Monitoring should include: real-time monitoring; baseline establishment; anomaly detection; security monitoring; performance monitoring; capacity monitoring; automated alerting; investigation procedures.

controls.name: Clock synchronization
controls.description: Synchronize clocks of all systems

article.full_text: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.
article.guidance: Clock synchronization should use: NTP or equivalent; authoritative time sources; monitoring of synchronization; protection of time sources; consideration of time zones; logging of time adjustments.

controls.name: Use of privileged utility programs
controls.description: Restrict and control use of privileged utility programs

article.full_text: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.
article.guidance: Utility program controls should include: restricted access; approval requirements; logging of use; separation from production systems; time-limited access; monitoring; regular reviews.

controls.name: Installation of software on operational systems
controls.description: Implement procedures to control software installation

article.section_name: Installation of software on operational systems
article.full_text: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.
article.guidance: Software installation controls should include: approval process; testing requirements; change management; configuration management; vulnerability assessment; compatibility testing; rollback procedures.

controls.name: Networks security
controls.description: Secure networks and protect network services

article.full_text: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
article.guidance: Network security should include: network segregation; firewalls; intrusion detection/prevention; network access control; wireless security; VPNs; DMZ; regular security assessments.

controls.name: Security of network services
controls.description: Identify and implement security mechanisms for network services

article.full_text: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services shall be identified, implemented and monitored.
article.guidance: Network service security should address: service level agreements; security features; capacity management; traffic management; redundancy; monitoring; vendor management.

controls.name: Segregation of networks
controls.description: Segregate groups of information services and users

article.full_text: Groups of information services, users and information systems shall be segregated in the organization's networks.
article.guidance: Network segregation should use: VLANs; subnets; DMZ; zero trust architecture; microsegmentation; application segmentation; access control lists; routing controls.

controls.name: Web filtering
controls.description: Manage access to external websites

article.full_text: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.
article.guidance: Web filtering should include: category-based filtering; malware protection; content inspection; HTTPS inspection; bypass prevention; logging; acceptable use enforcement; regular updates.

controls.name: Use of cryptography
controls.description: Define and implement rules for effective use of cryptography

article.full_text: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
article.guidance: Cryptography use should address: encryption algorithms; key lengths; key management; certificate management; regulatory compliance; quantum-readiness; crypto-agility; secure protocols.

controls.name: Secure development life cycle
controls.description: Establish and apply rules for secure development

article.full_text: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.
article.guidance: Secure SDLC should include: security requirements; threat modeling; secure coding standards; code review; security testing; vulnerability management; DevSecOps; security training.

controls.name: Application security requirements
controls.description: Identify and specify security requirements for applications

article.full_text: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.
article.guidance: Application security requirements should include: input validation; authentication; authorization; session management; error handling; logging; data protection; secure communications.

controls.name: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
controls.description: Establish and apply principles for engineering secure systems

article.section_name: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
article.full_text: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.
article.guidance: Secure architecture should include: defense in depth; least privilege; separation of duties; fail secure; simplicity; attack surface reduction; secure defaults; zero trust.

controls.name: Secure coding
controls.description: Apply secure coding principles in software development

article.full_text: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
article.guidance: Secure coding should address: input validation; output encoding; parameterized queries; error handling; cryptography; authentication; session management; OWASP Top 10; code review.

controls.name: Security testing in development and acceptance
controls.description: Define and implement security testing processes

article.section_name: Security testing in development and acceptance
article.full_text: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.
article.guidance: Security testing should include: static analysis; dynamic analysis; penetration testing; security scanning; fuzz testing; dependency checking; acceptance criteria; remediation verification.

controls.name: Outsourced development
controls.description: Supervise and monitor outsourced system development

article.full_text: The organization shall direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.
article.guidance: Outsourced development should address: contractual requirements; security requirements; code review; intellectual property; escrow arrangements; quality assurance; acceptance testing.

controls.name: Separation of development, test and production environments
controls.description: Separate development, test and production environments

article.section_name: Separation of development, test and production environments
article.full_text: Development, testing and production environments shall be separated and secured.
article.guidance: Environment separation should include: physical or logical separation; access controls; data protection; change management; different credentials; network segregation; monitoring.

controls.name: Change management
controls.description: Control changes to information processing facilities and systems

article.full_text: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.
article.guidance: Change management should include: formal approval; impact assessment; security review; testing; rollback procedures; documentation; communication; post-implementation review.

controls.name: Test information
controls.description: Protect and control test information

article.full_text: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
article.guidance: Test information should be: based on production data structure; sanitized/anonymized; access controlled; regularly refreshed; disposed securely; monitored; subject to data protection requirements.

controls.name: Protection of information systems during audit testing
controls.description: Plan and agree audit tests to minimize disruption

article.section_name: Protection of information systems during audit testing
article.full_text: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
article.guidance: Audit testing should include: advance planning; management approval; scope definition; timing considerations; backup verification; non-production testing; monitoring during testing; rollback capability.
